title: BitMine appoints new CEO amid Ether buying spree
summary: BitMine held about $11 billion worth of ETH as of this week, making it the largest Ether treasury in the cryptocurrency industry.

title: Bitcoin miners retreat sharply as BTC pulls back from recent highs
summary: Major mining stocks dropped 20%–50% this week, erasing billions in value as the sector continued to lag Bitcoin’s latest pullback.

title: Bitcoin's 2-year trend is about to collapse: Will bulls defend $90K?
summary: Bitcoin lost multiple critical support areas as data show short-term investors holding on to capitulation-level losses, raising fears of a deeper breakdown in BTC price.

title: Binance adds BlackRock’s BUIDL as off-exchange collateral for institutional traders
summary: The integration marks another step in centralized exchanges adopting tokenized Treasurys, expanding RWA collateral across major trading platforms.

title: Latest BTC market dip is relatively small, but sentiment is in freefall
summary: Bitcoin has seen bigger crashes during the current cycle, but investor sentiment is hovering near lows not seen since March.

title: Strategy’s NAV falls under 1, critics raise alarm after $5.7B Bitcoin wallet move
summary: Strategy moves $5.7 billion in Bitcoin as its net asset value to its Bitcoin holdings drops below one for the first time, sparking valuation concerns amid marketwide speculation.

title: ‘Volatility is your friend’: Eric Trump not bothered by Bitcoin, crypto carnage
summary: Eric Trump shrugs off an extended crypto sell-off as American Bitcoin ramps up its holdings and climbs into the top ranks of public BTC treasuries.

title: Price predictions 11/14: BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, HYPE, LINK, BCH
summary: Bitcoin has broken below the psychologically crucial $100,000 level, signaling that the bears are in full control. The next strong support on the downside is at $87,800.

title: Bitcoin falls to 6-month low as ETF demand collapses: Finance Redefined
summary: Bitcoin drops to a six-month low as spot ETF outflows resume despite the US shutdown ending, signaling weak demand and renewed pressure on crypto markets.

title: Real estate hybrid funds challenge DATs with mix of property and Bitcoin
summary: Most crypto treasury companies today lack an operational business that generates cash flow to finance additional digital asset purchases.
